item.title: Getting the Terminal Window Size using Scheme
item.description: Doing some experimenting with the Scheme programming language recently has been a lot of fun. It’s even simpler in most ways than Clojure. As part of that experimentation, I’ve been looking into implementing a simple, terminal-based text editor along the lines of kilo by following along with the tutorial series “Build Your Own Text Editor”. Working through those tutorials, one of the first things that smacks you in the face is just how low-level the C programming language is and how very different it feels when compared to Scheme or, really, any other Lisp variant.
